description: Everyone wants a hoverboard. Here are three real hoverboards that exist right now.

name: Ultimate Guide to Building Fantastic Tree Houses
text: Tree house life has largely been a storied fantasy, its details woven into books such as 'The Swiss Family Robinson' and 'Peter Pan.' But they actually have a long and rich history in the real world. Tree dwellings can be traced back to the people of the South Pacific and Southeast Asia, who lived in trees to provide secure homes for their families. They came and went via thatched baskets that were raised and lowered down the tree trunk. In the Middle Ages, Fransiscan monks used very basic tree-rooms to meditate, and Hindu monks also lived in tree houses to free themselves from earthbound considerations.
title: Ultimate Guide to Building Fantastic Tree Houses
description: Designer tree houses can be used as offices, guest houses, art studios, yoga rooms or simply as a quiet retreat to recharge. And if you have a tree in the right location, you might even be able to live in your tree house. But if you don't have the means to build one on your property but desire a taste of living above the ground, tree house tourism is a popular substitute. These unique destinations are found all over the globe and offer accommodations ranging from pared-down cabins to luxury resorts.

name: Book: Tree Houses, Fairy Tale Castles in the Air
text: Havens of imagination, the tree houses in this book may come in different shapes and sizes, but all require a commitment to climbing high. Inspiring photographs of 50 different dream structures sit alongside verdantly green illustrations by artist Patrick Hruby and detailed background information on each house, complete with a short biography for all architects featured.
title: Tree Houses, Fairy Tale Castles in the Air
description: Havens of imagination, the tree houses in this book may come in different shapes and sizes, but all require a commitment to climbing high. Inspiring photographs of 50 different dream structures sit alongside verdantly green illustrations by artist Patrick Hruby and detailed background information on each house, complete with a short biography for all architects featured.

name: Architectural Digest: 7 Treehouse Hotels That Reach New Heights in Design
text: Branch out and book one of these luxury treehouse accommodations
title: 7 Treehouse Hotels That Reach New Heights in Design
description: Perched atop some of the world’s most picturesque forests, these treehouse accommodations share in their unique ability to provide guests with sky-high views and luxury amenities. With features like a full bar, a fireplace, and unobstructed views of the surrounding landscape, it’s safe to say that these treehouses are far from ordinary. From the Benjamin Garcia Saxe–designed Floating House in Costa Rica to Mexico’s tubular Playa Viva hideaway, the creativity is endless when it comes to these innovative designs. Turn over a new leaf and discover these suspended resorts just in time for summer.

name: A Pair of Pine Cone–Shaped Tree Houses Overlook a Grand Fjord in Norway
text: Offering far-reaching views of Norway’s Hardangerfjord, each tree house employs clever solutions to provide a private bathroom and kitchenette inside. The structures are engineered to be supported by a central steel collar that wraps around the tree trunk.
title: A Pair of Pine Cone–Shaped Tree Houses Overlook a Grand Fjord in Norway
description: Perched along a forested hillside above Odda, Norway, each Woodnest tree house wraps around the trunk of a living pine tree. The serene location is a 15- to 30-minute hike up the mountain from a residential street below.

name: Treehouse Build Timelapse
text: Timelapse Video
title: Treehouse Build Timelapse
description: This is a tree house that my friend Aza and I built for a customer shortly after I built my original tree house. The build took about six months start to finish, but we weren't working on it full time. It is located in Sandpoint Idaho.

name: The Pinecone Treehouse: A Spectacular Tiny Home In The Trees
text: Living Big In A Tiny House
title: The Pinecone Treehouse: A Spectacular Tiny Home In The Trees
description: This treehouse is one you need to see to believe. Shaped like a pinecone and suspended from a circle of towering redwood trees, this geometric masterpiece hangs suspended like an otherworldly temple amongst the canopy.

name: You can buy this tiny treehouse shaped like a pinecone
text: Dozens of windows offer epic forest views. The sale includes the pinecone structure, the bathroom, and the catwalk.
title: You can buy this tiny treehouse shaped like a pinecone
description: Treehouse architecture is both fascinating and whimsical, a harkening to the joys and nostalgia of childhood. Modern treehouses, however, go way beyond a rickety retreat build with a few two-by-fours from the store. We’ve covered ski-in/ski-out treehouses in Montana, angular versions for sale in California, and a stunning contemporary treehouse in New York. None of them, however, quite compare to the latest treehouse to catch our eye: the Pinecone Treehouse. Designed by O2 Treehouse, a company known for their architecturally unique structures, the Pinecone was built to immerse its occupants in the beauty of the natural world.

name: Pinecone under construction
text: Pinecone under construction
title: Pinecone under construction

name: Treehouses in popular culture
text: Oh, yes, the Ewok village
title: Treehouses in popular culture
description: What discussion of treehouses would be complete without referencing the epic Ewok village from Return of the Jedi?

name: My Brain
text: The rest is fear of raptors.
title: My Brain
